goals: To enhance the theoretical understanding, computer implementation and hand-on practice of the start-of-the-art anti-counterfeiting technologies, especially for security printing and digital hologram.
syllabus:
I. Course Description:  
  
This course deals with the implementation of various anti-counterfeiting technologies. In recent years, researches on watermarking/data hiding have been very active in multimedia application. In this course, we focus on the theoretical understanding, computer implementation and hand-on practice of the state-of-the-art anti-counterfeiting technologies, especially for security printing and digital hologram.  
  
Prerequisite: Digital image processing or equivalent course required. Programming skill is recommended.  
  
  
II. Tentative Syllabus:  
  
1\. Introduction to anti-counterfeiting technology  
2\. Digital halftoning and watermarking  
3\. Holography  
4\. Dot matrix hologram  
5\. Optical document security  
6\. Security papers and special effects  
7\. Historical development of security printing  
8\. Security printing techniques  
9\. Noniridescent optically variable devices (OVD)  
10\. Iridescent optically variable devices  
11\. Value-added design  
12\. Project Presentation  
  
  
Class Rules and Procedures:  
  
1\. All students must submit HW sets on the due day. No late HW will be accepted. HW counts 30% of your course performance. Both loaner and copier of HW will receive zero credit. Group discussion is permitted and recommended.  
  
2\. Email is the best way for you to contact the Prof. Wang or the TA. We reply Emails immediately on the same or the following day. Check with the TA first on any problems associated with HW, grading, and records, before you come to see Prof. Wang during his office hours.
